reasoning: Severe beta thalassemia (thalassemia major) is reported as prevalence, not incidence, as it is a chronic lifelong condition. Global prevalence ~1-2 per 100k population, with highest in Mediterranean, Middle East, and Southeast Asia. Severe form represents ~70-80% of clinical beta thalassemia cases requiring transfusion. WHO and national registries provide prevalence estimates.
source: Galanello R et al. (2009). Beta-thalassemia. Orphanet J Rare Dis. 4:3
